content.title: Chief Minister’s UPSC Combined Civil Services Coaching Scheme
content.department: Department of Higher and Technical Education
content.details: The Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh has started the scheme to promote the local Arunachal Pradesh Schedule Tribe (APST) candidates to compete in the National Competitive Examination being conducted by the UPSC as there is a smaller number of candidates who appear and emerge successful from Arunachal Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide quality coaching for economically disadvantaged ST Candidates to enable them to compete in the National level competitive examination and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job.
benefits: Training Cost of ₹70,000 per student for General Studies along with study material to the candidates at no extra cost will be paid by the state government.
Training Cost of ₹30,000 per student for Optional Papers (Geography/ Public Administration, Sociology, etc.) (3-month course duration) will be paid by the state government.
Benefits can be availed for one year from the time of enrolment.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.
The applicant must belong to Arunachal Pradesh Schedule Tribe (APST) category.
The students who have qualified and gone through the counseling/ Pre-selection tests following the objective criteria, as deemed appropriate are eligible for the scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. The applicant needs to contact the Directorate of Higher and Technical Education and submit the application in the prescribed format.
documents_required: Dept. form for the Scheme to be filled
Coaching Institutes to conduct a selection test to undergo Coaching

faqs.question: Why was this scheme started by the state government?
faqs.answer: This scheme was started by the state government to promote the local APST candidates to compete in the National Competitive Examination being conducted by the UPSC.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide quality coaching for economically disadvantaged ST Candidates to enable them to compete in the National level competitive examination and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job.

faqs.question: What are the courses covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A total of 8 courses are covered under this scheme i.e. Civil Service examination, CDS, NDA, IFoS, IES, IEoS, CPO (Central Police Organisation) & CHS (Central Health Services).

faqs.question: Who is eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The students belonging to the Arunachal Pradesh Schedule Tribe (APST) category who have qualified and gone through the counseling/ pre-selection tests following the objective criteria, as deemed appropriate are eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for Schedule Tribe Category?
faqs.answer: Yes, only the Schedule Tribe of Arunachal Pradesh is eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the training/coaching cost of General Studies subjects?
faqs.answer: ₹70,000 per student for General Studies along with study material to the candidates at no extra cost will be borne by the State Government.

faqs.question: What is the training/coaching cost & duration of the Optional Paper?
faqs.answer: ₹30,000 per student for Optional Papers (Geography/ Public Administration, Sociology, etc.) will be borne by the State Government and the duration of the course is 3 months.

faqs.question: Is there any limit for the training cost of candidates per batch?
faqs.answer: Yes, the training Cost is restricted to 25 candidates per batch.

faqs.question: Is a one-time amount given directly to the students?
faqs.answer: Yes, a one-time amount is given directly to the students.

faqs.question: In which type of coaching institutes will the scheme be implemented?
faqs.answer: The Scheme will be implemented through the reputed coaching institutes/centers being run by the registered societies/ NGOs.

faqs.question: What are the terms of payment to the Coaching Institutes?
faqs.answer: 50% of the total cost-fee must be released by the State Govt. within one month from the date of empanelment after the bill has been raised by the Institute and the remaining 50% will be paid after completion of the course in all respects.

faqs.question: Is there any waitlist for the candidates?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a waitlist for the candidates. In case of any drop-out, the State Govt. in consultation with the Institute shall take immediate steps to allow the waitlisted candidates to join the course for the remaining period.

faqs.question: Can a candidate avail the benefits of the scheme outside the state?
faqs.answer: No, an eligible candidate can avail the benefits of the scheme in the state of Arunachal Pradesh only.

faqs.question: How can I apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: For applying under this scheme, the applicant needs to contact the Directorate of Higher and Technical Education.
